intro: Dizygotheca baillonii, commonly known as the Bailloni's legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
